elements.title: Cotton Blossom Singers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that up to 13 groups of the Cotton Blossom Singers (group pictured) toured through the United States at a time?

elements.title: Ada Buisson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ada Buisson died at the age of 27, and her short story "The Ghost's Summons" has been anthologised several times since her death?

elements.title: flag of Colorado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some members of the Daughters of the American Revolution came up with the idea to design a flag of Colorado, unaware that such a flag already existed?

elements.title: a massacre that took place there (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a massacre that took place there, the village of Sohagpur was renamed the "village of widows"?

elements.title: Theophilus Gates (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Theophilus Gates started a nudist free-love Christian sect in the mid–19th century near Pottstown, Pennsylvania?

elements.title: Jubbal State (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after its merger with India, the last raja of Jubbal State joined the Indian Foreign Service?

elements.title: I Drink Wine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adele reduced the length of "I Drink Wine" from fifteen to six minutes because her label thought that no one would play a fifteen-minute song on the radio?

elements.title: Dan Jones (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dan Jones discovered that he was talented at taking throw-ins after having been a javelin thrower at school?
